file.content:
--- theme: ../ layout: center ---
The Question

Awesome, you're writing AI code...

What do we do in 2026 to realize these gains?

So much is changing...

What should we OPTIMIZE toward?

Limited time and resources...

Where should we FOCUS our efforts?

One Goal:

Build systems that create TRUST in your AI.

---
theme: ../
layout: title
link: https://lascari-ai-learning.github.io/Skill-Issue/
---

::title::
The Skill Issue

::subtitle::
Agentic Coding in 2026


<!--
SPEAKER NOTES (Opening - 1 minute):

Let's cut through the hype. You've seen the AI coding demos on Twitter - vibe coding, agents building entire apps, 10x productivity claims. But what's the reality? Today we're going to talk about real value versus demo magic, and why the gap between success and failure comes down to one thing: skills.

TIMING: This presentation is ~15 minutes of content, with 5 minutes for Q&A.
-->

<style>
  .text-slate-steel { color: #4C5A61; }
  .text-bone-white { color: #EAE7DC; }
  .text-fog-grey { color: #B0B3B8; }
  .border-iron-ochre { border-color: #A35E35; }
  .bg-obsidian-black { background-color: #0C0C0C; }
  .bg-ash-graphite { background-color: #2B2B2B; }
</style>

--- layout: center ---
My Past 30 Days

Across all my projects

95%+ Written by AI

Client Projects

+193,334 | -78,907
Net: +114,427 Lines

API credits used

~$864 (+ $200/mo subscription)

$23,480 December Income

Real value is possible if you ENCODE your engineering knowledge

--- layout: default ---
What is a Skill?

Opinionated Markdown

The Format

  • Structured documentation files
  • Human and agent readable

Self-Discovery

Progressive Disclosure

  • Agents acquire context on-demand
  • No manual loading required

The New Standard

The Trend

  • Released by Anthropic
  • Adopted across AI coding tools

--- theme: ../ layout: center ---
DON'T Let Bad Examples Blind You

--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 2 ---

What Skills Do I Need?

Everyone has different workflows

🔧
Backend Dev
API design, DB migrations, testing patterns
🎨
Frontend Dev
Component patterns, debugging, styling
📊
Data Engineer
Pipeline workflows, SQL patterns, ETL
🚀
DevOps
CI/CD, infra-as-code, monitoring
Different Roles. Different Problems. Different Skills.

I have a lot of skills...

# My actual .claude/ directory
.claude/
├── agents/ (7 files)
├── commands/ (28 files)
├── hooks/ (3 files)
└── skills/ (98 files)
├── agent-session/ (21)
├── browser-mcp/ (5)
├── docs-framework/ (52)
├── git/ (2)
├── prompt-writing/ (10)
└── skill-creator/ (8)
Total: 141 files
But what do I show you?
My workflow is probably not the same as yours.
Everyone is different.

--- layout: default ---

The Problem

Cortex 2026 Benchmark Report

90% AI Adoption, Zero Standardization

  • +20% PRs per author, +23.5% incidents per PR, +30% change failure rate

"AI Amplifies Whatever You Have"

  • Good practices become GREAT
  • Bad practices become CATASTROPHIC

We've All Seen This

  • My story: Client project with 5000+ line files, 20 components per file, ...
  • UI Engineer using Cursor without understanding the patterns

--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 8 ---

How Skills Work

Agent Skill Reference →

Step 1: Create a SKILL.md file

# pdf-processing/SKILL.md
---
name: pdf-processing
description: Extract text and tables
from PDF files, fill forms, merge docs.
---
That's it for the minimum spec:
  • name - identifier (lowercase, hyphens)
  • description - what it does & when to use

Step 2: Add instructions

# pdf-processing/SKILL.md
---
name: pdf-processing
description: Extract text and tables...
---
# PDF Processing
## When to use this skill
Use when the user needs to work with PDFs...
## How to extract text
1. Use pdfplumber for extraction...
## How to fill forms
Run scripts/fill_form.py...
The markdown body contains:
  • Step-by-step instructions
  • Examples of inputs/outputs
  • References to scripts & files
  • Common edge cases

Step 3: Add supporting files

pdf-processing/
├── SKILL.md
├── scripts/
├── extract.py
└── fill_form.py
├── references/
├── FORMS.md
└── advanced-extraction.md
└── assets/
└── form-template.pdf
Optional directories:
  • scripts/ - executable code
  • references/ - detailed docs
  • assets/ - templates, data files

What the agent sees at startup

<!-- In the system prompt -->
<available_skills>
<skill>
<name>pdf-processing</name>
<description>Extract text and tables from PDFs...</description>
<location>.claude/skills/pdf-processing/SKILL.md</location>
</skill>
<skill>
<name>data-analysis</name>
<description>Analyze datasets, generate charts...</description>
<location>.claude/skills/data-analysis/SKILL.md</location>
</skill>
</available_skills>
Progressive disclosure:
  • ~100 tokens per skill
  • Only metadata loaded
  • Full content on demand

Worked Example

<!-- Agent's system prompt -->
<available_skills>
<skill>
<name>pdf-processing</name>
<description>Extract text and tables from PDFs...</description>
<location>.claude/skills/pdf-processing/SKILL.md</location>
</skill>
<skill>
<name>data-analysis</name>
<description>Analyze datasets, generate charts...</description>
<location>.claude/skills/data-analysis/SKILL.md</location>
</skill>
</available_skills>
User Input
"Extract tables from invoice.pdf"
Agent Reads
pdf-processing skill
Agent Reads
advanced-extraction.md
> Read .claude/skills/pdf-processing/SKILL.md

Worked Example

# pdf-processing/SKILL.md
---
name: pdf-processing
description: Extract text and tables...
---
# PDF Processing
## How to extract tables
For table extraction, see
references/advanced-extraction.md
User Input
"Extract tables from invoice.pdf"
Agent Reads
pdf-processing skill
Agent Reads
advanced-extraction.md
> Read .claude/skills/pdf-processing/references/advanced-extraction.md

Worked Example

# references/advanced-extraction.md
# Advanced Table Extraction
## Prerequisites
Requires pdfplumber library
## Usage
Run the extraction script:
python scripts/extract.py <input.pdf>
User Input
"Extract tables from invoice.pdf"
Agent Reads
pdf-processing skill
Agent Reads
advanced-extraction.md
> Bash python .claude/skills/pdf-processing/scripts/extract.py invoice.pdf
Now you can TRUST that every PDF extraction happens the same way, every time.

--- theme: ../ layout: speaker --- # About Me
Applied AI Engineer & Consultant
### Background - 3 years AI Engineering - 1 Year Independent Contracting & Consulting ::speaker-name:: Ford Lascari ::image::

--- theme: ../ layout: default --- # Before We Get Into the "How"...
Let's make this concrete. Think about working with a junior engineer.

The Handoff

1. You scope out the task
2. You hand it off
3. They implement (you're not watching)
4. You review the PR, give feedback

But You Don't Just Wing It

→ Tests that must pass
→ Commit rules & linting
→ GitHub Actions / CI
→ Company protocols
→ Documentation to read first
Working with AI is the same.
Encode this information so the AI can operate at scale.

--- theme: ../ layout: default ---
The Process

1. Find It

Figure out what you need

  • What do I do repeatedly?
  • What takes too long?
  • What knowledge only I have?

2. Build It

Make the skill, iterate on it

  • Start simple
  • Use it yourself
  • Refine until it works

3. Share It

Pass it out or automate

  • Share with your team
  • Or step out of the loop entirely

--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 6 ---

Example: Front-End Debug Skill

The Problem

The manual debugging loop:
  1. Add console.log statements
  2. Reload the page
  3. Screenshot the page
  4. Copy console output
  5. Paste into AI chat
  6. Discuss, repeat...
What if the agent could:
  • Add debug logs itself
  • Refresh the page for you
  • Pull console logs directly
  • Screenshot the page automatically
  • Clean up when done completely

The Skill

The Workflow

# SKILL.md
---
name: browser-mcp
description: Browser automation
---
# Tools
browser_screenshot, browser_navigate
browser_get_console_logs, ...
# Debug Log Convention
console.log('[DEBUG-AGENT]',
'[Context]', { data });
# Cookbook
- IF: Debugging front-end
THEN: workflows/debug.md
# workflows/debug.md
<workflow id="frontend-debugging">
<phase name="Setup">
Confirm page with user...
<loop name="Debug">
<step name="Observe">
Screenshot + console logs...
<step name="Instrument">
Add [DEBUG-AGENT] logs...
<step name="Refresh">
Reload, re-observe...
</loop>
<phase name="Fix">
Apply solution...
<phase name="Cleanup">
Remove all markers...
</workflow>
SETUP
Confirm page
→
DEBUG LOOP
OBSERVE
Screenshot + logs
→
INSTRUMENT
Add debug logs
→
REFRESH
Reload page
→
FIX
Apply solution
→
CLEANUP
Remove markers
Agent handles mechanical tedium
  • Taking screenshots of the page
  • Pulling console logs
  • Adding instrumentation
  • Refreshing and re-capturing
User confirms judgment calls
  • "Is this the right page?"
  • "I'm seeing something different..."
  • "Does this fix seem right?"
  • "Based on the codebase, should we..."

--- theme: ../ layout: default --- # Key Takeaways
Don't Let the Bad Examples Blind You
This technology is coming - learn to use it well
AI is a HUGE Force Multiplier
If you know what you're doing, you'll see exponential gains
The Road to 10x is Incremental
10% here, 5% there - these compound over months
The Math
Token Spend per Engineer: ~$400/mo
10 Engineers Token Spend: $4,000/mo
Average Engineer Cost: ~$10,000/mo
20% More Effective = $20,000 Value
Spend $4K → Get $20K Value 5x ROI
The Mentality Shift
"How can I systematize my knowledge into a skill the AI can be trusted to do?"
Bit by bit, we build AI systems we trust to complete work on our behalf.

--- theme: ../ ---
Let's Connect
LinkedIn
Questions? Let's talk about building skills for your team.

references/advanced-extraction.md

Worked Example

# references/advanced-extraction.md
# Advanced Table Extraction
## Prerequisites
Requires pdfplumber library
## Usage
Run the extraction script:
python scripts/extract.py <input.pdf>
User Input
"Extract tables from invoice.pdf"
Agent Reads
pdf-processing skill
Agent Reads
advanced-extraction.md
> Bash python .claude/skills/pdf-processing/scripts/extract.py invoice.pdf
Now you can TRUST that every PDF extraction happens the same way, every time.

tool_input.old_string: Figure out what you need
tool_input.new_string: Figure Out What You Need

tool_response.oldString: Figure out what you need
tool_response.newString: Figure Out What You Need
tool_response.originalFile:
--- theme: ../ layout: default ---
The Process

1. Find It

Figure out what you need

  • What do I do repeatedly?
  • What takes too long?
  • What knowledge only I have?

2. Build It

Make the skill, iterate on it

  • Start simple
  • Use it yourself
  • Refine until it works

3. Share It

Pass it out or automate

  • Share with your team
  • Or step out of the loop entirely

tool_input.old_string: The manual debugging loop:
tool_input.new_string: The Manual Debugging Loop:

tool_response.oldString: The manual debugging loop:
tool_response.newString: The Manual Debugging Loop:
tool_response.originalFile:
--- theme: ../ layout: default clicks: 6 ---

Example: Front-End Debug Skill

The Problem

The manual debugging loop:
  1. Add console.log statements
  2. Reload the page
  3. Screenshot the page
  4. Copy console output
  5. Paste into AI chat
  6. Discuss, repeat...
What if the agent could:
  • Add debug logs itself
  • Refresh the page for you
  • Pull console logs directly
  • Screenshot the page automatically
  • Clean up when done completely

The Skill

The Workflow

# SKILL.md
---
name: browser-mcp
description: Browser automation
---
# Tools
browser_screenshot, browser_navigate
browser_get_console_logs, ...
# Debug Log Convention
console.log('[DEBUG-AGENT]',
'[Context]', { data });
# Cookbook
- IF: Debugging front-end
THEN: workflows/debug.md
# workflows/debug.md
<workflow id="frontend-debugging">
<phase name="Setup">
Confirm page with user...
<loop name="Debug">
<step name="Observe">
Screenshot + console logs...
<step name="Instrument">
Add [DEBUG-AGENT] logs...
<step name="Refresh">
Reload, re-observe...
</loop>
<phase name="Fix">
Apply solution...
<phase name="Cleanup">
Remove all markers...
</workflow>
SETUP
Confirm page
→
DEBUG LOOP
OBSERVE
Screenshot + logs
→
INSTRUMENT
Add debug logs
→
REFRESH
Reload page
→
FIX
Apply solution
→
CLEANUP
Remove markers
Agent handles mechanical tedium
  • Taking screenshots of the page
  • Pulling console logs
  • Adding instrumentation
  • Refreshing and re-capturing
User confirms judgment calls
  • "Is this the right page?"
  • "I'm seeing something different..."
  • "Does this fix seem right?"
  • "Based on the codebase, should we..."

lines:
-
The manual debugging loop:

+
The Manual Debugging Loop:

tool_input.old_string: Token Spend per Engineer:
tool_input.new_string: Token Spend Per Engineer:

tool_response.oldString: Token Spend per Engineer:
tool_response.newString: Token Spend Per Engineer:
tool_response.originalFile:
--- theme: ../ layout: default --- # Key Takeaways
Don't Let the Bad Examples Blind You
This technology is coming - learn to use it well
AI is a HUGE Force Multiplier
If you know what you're doing, you'll see exponential gains
The Road to 10x is Incremental
10% here, 5% there - these compound over months
The Math
Token Spend per Engineer: ~$400/mo
10 Engineers Token Spend: $4,000/mo
Average Engineer Cost: ~$10,000/mo
20% More Effective = $20,000 Value
Spend $4K → Get $20K Value 5x ROI
The Mentality Shift
"How can I systematize my knowledge into a skill the AI can be trusted to do?"
Bit by bit, we build AI systems we trust to complete work on our behalf.

lines: <div class="space-y-2 font-mono text-sm bg-white p-4 rounded-lg border-l-4 border-purple-600 text-gray-900">
The Math

file.content:
--- theme: ../ layout: center ---
The Question

Awesome, you're writing AI code...

What do we do in 2026 to realize these gains?

So much is changing...

What should we OPTIMIZE toward?

Limited time and resources...

Where should we FOCUS our efforts?

One Goal:

Build systems that create TRUST in your AI.

--- layout: center ---
My Past 30 Days

Across all my projects

95%+ Written by AI

Client Projects

+193,334 | -78,907
Net: +114,427 Lines

API Credits Used

~$864 (+ $200/mo subscription)

$23,480 December Income

Real value is possible if you ENCODE your engineering knowledge
